author: tjitse
title: NFTs for a better world
description: Технология NFT позволяет использовать новые возможности для расширения прав и возможностей людей, чтобы внести свой вклад в улучшение мира. Однако большинство проектов сосредоточены исключительно на визуальном развитии

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal clearly addresses the way to overcome the use of NFT technology majoritively focused on visual development projects. The proposal wants to use NFTs for content-oriented growth and sustainability while encouraging others to do the same

The proposal also consists of a detailed fund breakdown and the required funds of 40000 USD seem reasonable. as a consequence, the chances of the plan being completed is very likely

Provided all the above information, the given data is enough to track the progress and success of the proposal

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal seeks to explore another use case for NFT by sharing NFT-enabled content on their platform. Since this is on the Miscellaneous challenge, I would agree that it fit into the challenge. The solution focuses on growth and sustainability-oriented content which might have limited Impact to the wider community. The MVP phase 1 focuses only on posting content as a blog, I would love to see the technical details of how this will incorporate NFT to the blog post and what differentiate it from normal blog post.
In phase 1 , The team proposed at least one post a week ,one page for live online classes , What happens if there is a need to post more NFT enabled Content.
I am concerned about the scalability of the Platform. How can millions of users use such a platform?. In my opinion , this is a good Idea but the proposed solution does not include much technical details on how to achieve NFT-enabled blog content but having watched the attached Videos, the Impact can be clearly seen.
f6_assessments.q1:
The Development is divided into sub phases , 1 , 2 and 3. I like the fact that the team is currently working on the Idea and have already built a oneTile community around their Idea which will help them get early feedback with potential users and in turn increases the feasibility of the project. The budget requested for Phase 1 of the MVP but I don’t agree with some of the budget Item allocation . For example “Users have their own profiles, linked to their Google accounts' ' for 5000USD. While there is also “Wallet authentication for platform access ($2000)”

As a Technical person , I can say both of them are Authentication modules. The Team should make an effort to choose which Authentication method will be well suitable for their use cases.
Is a Decentralized Wallet Connect like Nami or Yoiroi or Centralized OAuth2 Authentication like Google Login. I would suggest If the team is planning to use both , System design details should be added to give the reason why it's needed to increase the project feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: Assessing the auditability of this project , I noticed that in the roap map within first month , there is  10K series of NFTs with “ inspirational quotes are pre-minted” and that got me wondered because i was reading the development phased 1 which suggest a NFT-enabled Blog content to be posted once a week but pre-minted NFT inspirational quotes does contradict the Idea of once a week NFT Blog Post. There is a definition of success for 3 , 6 and 12 month and a good road map.

f6_assessments.q0:
Although the problem statement seems valid, the solution proposed seems too technology driven (technology available, looking for applications) and doesnt seem to offer a real different product from what already is available in the market, even if in multiple platforms. As I understood, the idea is to create something similar with a social media but based on NFT technology. The whole point here is that you dont need NFT to create these platforms. Moreover, the main feaures highlighted in the general plan sections are available already in facebook and other social media, as sharing texts and asking quistions and platforms for commercializing NFT already exists. It also suggest it would be similar to blogs but it is not  the content it will be posted. There are just vague terms as "inspiring texts" - what is inspiring for the proposal?
Also, it is mentioned that the contents (as posts) will be turned into NFT and auctionted. As visual arts, texts could also be NFTs, of course, but it would be important to assess beforehand if theres indeed a market for it. If we think in real life, visual arts (as paintings, portrayts) have their values for being unique - and rare- but texts not - as they are printable anywhere. So, in order to validate this premise, and hence, the project, the potential of NFT texts  generating revenue should be brought in the proposal.

As a suggestion of potential application for NFT in texts, purchased books and course/traning materials, handouts could be turned into NFT to avoid piracy.

Although some features as a in-app marketplace for NFT auction and wallter integration might be useful, separated already consolidated platforms for these purpose will likely offer a better service and interaction as they are dedicated to it and have already a established number of users.


In general, the idea of turning texts and contents in NFTs is valid and having a platform for it would be good but their commercial value should be validated beforehand (like a business plan). Also, the content that would be available here could be better described.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team description in the proposal is vague but in the provided website there's a bit more details (although some of these descriptions are also a bit vague). It is also provided a linkedin link for the main proposer. As suggestions, I'd include a more professional and straightfoward description of experience and capabilities of the team within the proposal and provide links for all of them, besides the website.

 There's a good plan in place with activities and the features that will be added along the phases and summarized timeline with the months, which seems to be enough. the budget breakdown is sensible but project is a bit expensive, specially considering the budget is just for the MVP.
f6_assessments.q2:
There are nice milestones and deliverables distribuited along time (1st, 3rd , 6th month and long term) , a clear definition of success and a couple of good KPIs (community members, # of NFT sold, ). 

As risk management, I'd consider challenges in finding commercial value for NFT texts and engaging people in the coommunity (this would be a lot related to the perception of value again and communication). mitigation strategy for these risks should be put in place.

f6_assessments.q0: Since the Misc Challenge welcomes any kind of proposal the impact cannot be assessed based on achieving the goals set in the challenge. The team has outlined their problem statement as follows: "NFT technology enables new ways to empower people to contribute to a better world. But most projects focus solely on visual development." Their solution to this so-called problem is text-based NFTs that provide access to a "platform" which they keep referring to throughout the proposal but it's not mentioned even once what is the technology choice for that platform. While the promotional video addresses important topics, this feels like a Web2 solution in the age of Web3. The internet is full of communities dotted with blog posts and yoga videos. It's hard to see how this would be any better than those existing "platforms".
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal lacks technical detail. Is it going to be a Webiste.com website or something else? Is the said "wallet authentication" handled via Yoroi dApp Connector or how? Why would a decentralized service require a centralized identity (Google profile)? The team introductions are not in the proposal but a generic description can be found from the website. There seems to be a high degree of will but is there skill?
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal's progress is somewhat difficult to track and audit due to the lack of proper roadmap, mielstones and KPIs - as well as the aforementioned technical details. Sure, the team can state that this and that page was added "to the platform" or that a certain percentage of the NFTs have been sold. But I fail to see how these really measure success.
